item.title: parseIncomingPackets(): code Too Large
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

sigh Instead of putting every ounce of code inside the switch statement in the parseIncomingPackets method, have each seperate case call a method. Everyone seems to put their shops and the like inside the case - there’s no need for this. Change it. =\

If it’s still too big, then by all means do what Javac said… but I find it hard to believe.

Read full topic

item.title: parseIncomingPackets(): code Too Large
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

make a parseExcessIncomingPackets() method that handles any other cases, and put this as the default in your switch statement

default: parseExcessIncomingPackets(pkttype);
